uientry.unicode: Use this panel to change settings for the campaign and battlefield areas of the game.

state.unicode: Change the frequency of advice and how you receive it by using the two drop-down menus and the text and audio options below.

uientry.s:
local parent = UIComponent(UIComponent(Address):Parent(3))
function OnSelect() parent:LuaCall("SelectOption", Address) end

local parent = UIComponent(UIComponent(Address):Parent(3))
function OnSelect() parent:LuaCall("SelectOption", Address) end

dofile "data/ui/templates/template.fe_button_standard.lua"
local this = UIComponent(Address)
function OnClickUp() UIComponent(this:Parent()):LuaCall("Notify", Component.Messages.StateChange, this:CurrentState(), Address) end

local parent = UIComponent(UIComponent(Address):Parent(3))
function OnSelect() parent:LuaCall("SelectOption", Address) end

local parent = UIComponent(UIComponent(Address):Parent(3))
function OnSelect() parent:LuaCall("SelectOption", Address) end

state.unicode: These settings are specifically for the campaign area of the game.

If this is checked you will be able to see any visible CPU player's moves during the end turn phase.||This can help to keep a track on some of the CPU's locations and movements, but the end turn phase will also take longer.

uientry.unicode: When this is ticked the game will try to find battles for you to join while you are playing the campaign game.

state.unicode: Search continuously for other players Drop-in battles
Enable this to send and receive voice chat from other players.
Move the slider to adjust the difficulty level on the battlefield.

If this is checked, players will have a more restricted UI in battles.||There will be no radar, reduced information on enemy banners and tooltips, and the camera will be restricted to units line of sight.

A battle with a set time limit will end when the time is up.||If this happens, the defending army will win the battle.||With no time limit set, the battle will simply play out until one army is victorious.

uientry.s:
